title: Missing Weymouth man found dead after blizzard
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Brendan L. Rogers, 45, went missing during a blizzard and was found dead by the Weymouth Police Department.
Rogers, last seen Monday on Commercial Street in Weymouth, was located in a wooded area off the Fore River.
No foul play is suspected in Rogers's death, and over 18 inches of snow fell in Weymouth during the blizzard.

title: 68-year-old man pronounced dead after reported neighbor dispute in Middleborough
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 68-year-old man was found unresponsive after a reported neighbor dispute in Middleborough and later pronounced dead at Morton Hospital.
Middleborough Police arrested another man at the same address, charging him with assault and battery on a police officer.
The Massachusetts State Police and Middleborough Police are investigating the death; the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner will determine the cause.

title: Here’s Dave Epstein on what to expect — generally — this March
author: David Epstein
bullets: March will begin with cold Arctic air and potential snowstorms in Boston, continuing winter-like conditions.
Boston's snow accumulation this season reached 60 inches, the highest since the winter of 2021-22.
Milder temperatures are expected in Boston's second week of March, with a possibility of reaching 60 degrees.

title: Third victim reportedly dies after Pawtucket ice rink shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Gerald Dorgan, 75, passes away following the Pawtucket ice rink shooting, making him the third victim to die.
The shooting occurred during a high school hockey game, involving a family dispute where Robert Dorgan targeted relatives.
The shooter, Robert Dorgan, was disarmed but committed suicide, leaving behind multiple victims and a grieving family.

title: Cat saved after days stuck in a tree following the blizzard that blanketed Rhode Island
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matt Lyons climbed 40-50 feet to rescue Pixie, a cat stuck in a tree during Rhode Island's blizzard.
Pixie was stuck in the tree for nearly two days with three feet of snow on the ground.
Traditional rescue attempts failed, prompting Lyons to successfully climb and carry Pixie down using a sweatshirt.

title: 4 questions facing Bruins as they return from Olympic break
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins resume NHL play against Columbus Blue Jackets after a three-week Olympic break.
Bruins hold second Wild Card spot in Eastern Conference with 32-20-5 record and 69 points.
Trade deadline decisions loom as Bruins consider adding young talent or trading key players.

title: Fire erupts at MCI-Norfolk prison, no major injuries reported
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A fire at MCI-Norfolk prison was quickly extinguished with no major injuries on Wednesday afternoon.
Three incarcerated individuals were treated for smoke inhalation; one staff member was hospitalized as a precaution.
Officials are assessing fire damage and investigating its cause at the medium-security prison facility.

title: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as an MVP candidate
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as an NBA MVP candidate due to his standout performance this season.
Brown averages 29.2 points, 7.0 rebounds, and 4.9 assists, keeping the Celtics competitive despite losing key players.
The Celtics hold a second-place record in the East, largely attributed to Brown's leadership and scoring ability.

title: Harvard professor on leave as college investigates ties to Jeffrey Epstein
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Harvard professor Martin Nowak is on paid leave amid a probe into his ties with Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein donated $6.5 million to Harvard, primarily supporting Nowak's Program for Evolutionary Dynamics.
Nowak visited Epstein's private island in 2013 and Epstein frequently accessed Harvard facilities.

title: Malden educator, basketball coach charged with rape in incident involving high school student, officials say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Malden educator Scott Marino charged with rape and other offenses involving a high school student, arrested by Stoneham police.
Marino, head coach for Malden High's girls' basketball team, is also facing charges of indecent assault and selling liquor to a minor.
Malden Public Schools placed Marino on leave after being informed by police of investigations into the alleged incident.
